Title.evidence: This study aimed to explore the association between preoperative platelet count and the risk of postoperative AKI in patients undergoing abdominal surgery.

Trial_Design.evidence: This retrospective cohort study analyzed data from the INformative Surgical Patient dataset for Innovative Research Environment (INSPIRE) database.

Participants.evidence: patients who underwent abdominal surgery at Seoul National University Hospital from 2011 to 2020.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to explore the association between preoperative platelet count and the risk of postoperative AKI in patients undergoing abdominal surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Logistic regression and restricted cubic spline analyses were used to evaluate the relationship between preoperative platelet count and the risk of developing AKI.

Result_Outcome.evidence: A significant negative association was observed between preoperative platelet counts and postoperative AKI risk across all models (P for trend < 0.001 in unadjusted and partially adjusted models, 0.002 in fully adjusted model).
